Class WebXContainerElement

java.lang.Object
webx.WebXElement
webx.WebXContainerElement
Direct Known Subclasses:

    • hxVals

      public WebXContainerElement hxVals(String val)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hx-vals attribute allows you to add to the parameters that will be submitted with an AJAX request.
      Overrides:
      hxVals in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      val - Custom data to be send to the server along with the request. Useful when sending post requests.
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new P()
 		.hxVals("{\"myVal\": 100}");
 	new P()
 		.hxVals("js:{\"compute\": 100 * 5 * somevar}");

    • hxSwapOob

      public WebXContainerElement hxSwapOob(String value)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hx-swap-oob attribute allows you to specify that some content in a response should be swapped into the DOM somewhere other than the target, that is “Out of Band”. This allows you to piggy back updates to other element updates on a response.
      Overrides:
      hxSwapOob in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      value - Activation (true) or a swap strategy
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new Button("Click Me")
 		.hxPost("/greet)
 		.hxSwapOob("true");

    • hxBoost

      public WebXContainerElement hxBoost(boolean activate)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hxBoost attribute allows you to “boost” normal anchors and form tags to use AJAX instead.
      Overrides:
      hxBoost in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      activate - The boolean value used to enable or disable the boost
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs

    • hxConfirm

      public WebXContainerElement hxConfirm(String message)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hxConfirm method allows you to confirm an action before issuing a request. This can be useful in cases where the action is destructive and you want to ensure that the user really wants to do it.
      Overrides:
      hxConfirm in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      message - Text to be used as a confirmation message
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs

    • hxOn

      public WebXContainerElement hxOn(String event)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hxOn method allow you to embed scripts inline to respond to events directly on an element; similar to the onevent properties found in HTML, such as onClick. The hx-on* attributes improve upon onevent by enabling the handling of any arbitrary JavaScript event, for enhanced Locality of Behaviour (LoB) even when dealing with non-standard DOM events
      Overrides:
      hxOn in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      event - Event which triggers the requests
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs

    • hxExt

      public WebXContainerElement hxExt(String ext)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hxExt attribute enables an htmx extension for an element and all its children. The value can be a single extension name or a comma separated list of extensions to apply. The hxExt tag may be placed on parent elements if you want a plugin to apply to an entire swath of the DOM, and on the body tag for it to apply to all htmx requests.
      Overrides:
      hxExt in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      ext - The extension to be used
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs

      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      url - Url for the websocket server
      Returns:
      A modified element

    • hxSwap

      public WebXContainerElement hxSwap(String strategy)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hx-swap attribute allows you to specify how the response will be swapped in relative to the target of an AJAX request. If you do not specify the option, the default is htmx.config.defaultSwapStyle (innerHTML).
      Overrides:
      hxSwap in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      strategy - The swap strategy to be used
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new Button("Click Me")
 		.hxPost("/greet)
 		.hxSwap("outerHTML");

    • id

      public WebXContainerElement id(String id)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The id global attribute defines an identifier (ID) which must be unique in the whole document. The purpose of the ID attribute is to identify a single element when linking (using a fragment identifier), scripting, or styling (with CSS). Elements with ID attributes are available as global properties. The property name is the ID attribute, and the property value is the element.
      Overrides:
      id in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      id - The identifier for the element
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs

    • hxTarget

      public WebXContainerElement hxTarget(String target)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hx-target attribute allows you to target a different element for swapping than the one issuing the AJAX request.
      Overrides:
      hxTarget in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      target - The target element to be replaced with the response html
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new Button("Click Me")
 		.hxPost("/greet)
 		.hxTarget("#parentdiv");

    • hxTrigger

      public WebXContainerElement hxTrigger(String trigger)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The hx-trigger attribute allows you to specify what triggers an AJAX request.
      Overrides:
      hxTrigger in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      trigger - The event that triggers the http request
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs 
         
 	new P("00:00:00")
 		.hxPost("/get_clock")
 		.hxTrigger("every 1s");

    • className

      public WebXContainerElement className(String names)
      Description copied from class: WebXElement
      The class global attribute is a list of the classes of the element, separated by ASCII whitespace. Classes allow CSS and JavaScript to select and access specific elements via the class selectors or functions like the document.getElementsByClassName().
      Overrides:
      className in class WebXElement
      Parameters:
      names - Whitespace separated list of classes
      Returns:
      A modified element
      See Also:
      • htmx docs
